definition: apex/crown of the head/top/roof/most/to carry on the head/to push to the top/to go against/to replace/to substitute/to be subjected to (an aerial bombing, hailstorm etc)/(slang) to "bump" a forum thread to raise its profile/classifier for headwear, hats, veils etc
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: She feared for the little boy when she saw him at the top of the tree.
sentences.chinese: 看着树顶上的小男孩，她替他捏了一把汗。

sentences.english: It rolled on top of a sonorous vault.
sentences.chinese: 它在天顶上轰隆隆地行驶。

sentences.english: Long streamers hung from the tops of tall buildings.
sentences.chinese: 长幅标语从高高的楼顶上垂挂下来。

sentences.english: Jamie was going to walk along the top of the wall but he chickened out at the last minute.
sentences.chinese: 吉米打算沿着墙顶上走，但是在最后时刻他怯退了。

sentences.english: It suspends its victims from the cave ceiling until it is ready to feast.
sentences.chinese: 它把猎物吊在洞顶上，直到要享用时才取下来。

sentences.english: Succesfully climbed up to the peak. Taking a quarter rest there.
sentences.chinese: 成功登顶，在顶上休息一刻钟。

sentences.english: They swung huge car advertisements from the top of the tall buildings.
sentences.chinese: 他们从高楼顶上向下悬挂了巨大的汽车广告。

sentences.english: The mixed cement has been hoisted up the building.
sentences.chinese: 拌好的水泥灰浆已吊到建筑物顶上了。

sentences.english: A skinny fox sits on the hill above.
sentences.chinese: 一只瘦骨嶙峋的狐狸趴在高处的小丘顶上。

sentences.english: The owners of a building on Times Square held that first party on top of their building.
sentences.chinese: 时代广场的楼房业主在楼顶上举行了第一次派对。

sentences.english: Thus began the tradition of the little angel on top of the Christmas tree.
sentences.chinese: 从此，圣诞树顶上的小天便成了一种传统。

sentences.english: I supinely begin look goes against beautiful scene, unconsciously infatuateds.
sentences.chinese: 我仰起头看着顶上的美景，不觉痴迷。

sentences.english: When Grave Defiler comes into play, reveal the top four cards of your library.
sentences.chinese: 当墓场污者进场时，展示你牌库顶上的四张牌。

sentences.english: A 25-watt lamp was suspended from the ceiling, functioning to luminate us every night.
sentences.chinese: 顶上悬一个25瓦的白炽灯泡，在夜晚给予光明。

sentences.english: Perching high on top of the precious tree.
sentences.chinese: 牠高高高地栖在这珍贵的树顶上。

sentences.english: We were shivering at the merciless northerly winds up on the very peak of the Phoenix Mountain.
sentences.chinese: 在凤凰山的顶上，我们瑟缩于无情的北风之中。

definition: apex/crown of the head/top/roof/most/to carry on the head/to push to the top/to go against/to replace/to substitute/to be subjected to (an aerial bombing, hailstorm etc)/(slang) to "bump" a forum thread to raise its profile/classifier for headwear, hats, veils etc
middle/center/right in the middle or center/nub
the top/above/overhead/upwards/the top margin/above-mentioned/those higher up
to hang in the air/suspended in midair/(fig.) uncertain
